div.ab: Copper is bett and latten are proper to cast & at the right heat when they throw off, while one stirs them in the crucible, a very white flame & when the bath is very liquid.
Some cast in well ground ceruse pour le, others in flour moistened several times with oil & g & dried in the sun.
Others, for casting in lead, old printers' type or the composition thereof.
Others put into the tin or lead a substance of fixed quicksilver which makes it run.
